codes.verbatim_quote: I've downloaded the package and installed it and it works really well and easy
codes.context: Initial warm-up reflection on the installation process before starting usability tasks

codes.verbatim_quote: So, here we have a very nice interface
codes.context: First impression when viewing the system homepage and catalog during warm-up exploration

codes.verbatim_quote: loading 100 of items takes a little bit time
codes.context: Noticing performance delay when catalog loads full list of 100 items during initial exploration

codes.verbatim_quote: We have an option to add new record and something like time vault. I can assume that there is for the deleted resources
codes.context: User hypothesizes about time vault functionality based on naming and visual cues during warm-up

codes.verbatim_quote: Okay, let's try to look at the items how they look like. Okay, here is the main information. Edit, delete, the type of resource. No issue
codes.context: Evaluating entity page layout and finding information clearly presented with obvious action buttons

codes.verbatim_quote: number 1, volume. I think there is a list of references. Okay, it's pretty clear
codes.context: Reviewing bibliographic record structure during warm-up and understanding volume/reference relationships

codes.verbatim_quote: It's exactly what we were looking for. So, we have to make some changes in the authors lists
codes.context: Immediately understanding task requirements after accessing the target bibliographic record

codes.verbatim_quote: Type of the agent. Do we have an identifier? Yeah, we have it. We have an identifier. It's ORCID
codes.context: Discovering that author entity requires identifier and identifying ORCID as the appropriate type

codes.verbatim_quote: it's quite easy to find exactly the author we need
codes.context: Using ORCID identifier to search for Caroline Scagel and successfully finding existing author entity

codes.verbatim_quote: So, what we need to do to add this author. Here is the link to the author, but did we add it?
codes.context: After selecting author from search results, user uncertain whether author was added to publication

codes.verbatim_quote: Yeah, I think so, but how we can change? Aha, we can make it like this. Pretty clear
codes.context: Learning that authors can be reordered and discovering the mechanism for changing author sequence

codes.verbatim_quote: So, we have first author, Caroline Scagel. Is this all we need? Save changes. We need to confirm. Okay, it looks like we did. Let's check. Yeah, we have the first author. Caroline
codes.context: Saving changes and verifying that Caroline Scagel was successfully added as first author

codes.verbatim_quote: Great. Pretty easy, like two minutes, I think
codes.context: Expressing satisfaction after completing Task 1 in approximately two minutes, faster than expected

codes.verbatim_quote: We need to merge duplicate author entities. Return to this journal article. Okay, we are here. Navigate to the author page for Richard. Richard. Yeah, here is Richard
codes.context: Task 2: Efficiently navigating from journal article to Richard Carew's author page via hyperlink

codes.verbatim_quote: Your task is to merge any duplicate author entities you find. Aha, we have similar resources with different identifiers. So, we have this one for this author and another two of them
codes.context: Discovering similar resources notification showing duplicate author entities on Richard Carew's page

codes.verbatim_quote: Okay, we can trust that this Richard and these two Richards are the same, so we have to merge
codes.context: Making decision to trust system's similar resources detection and proceed with merging duplicates

codes.verbatim_quote: Okay, this one we keep. Which one we need to keep? Not really clear
codes.context: Confusion about which duplicate author entity should be kept as primary during merge operation

codes.verbatim_quote: we will merge this one and we will merge the next one also. Okay, but did we do it? It looks like the second time it wasn't successful or we need to do anything else
codes.context: After merging first duplicate, user uncertain whether second merge operation succeeded

codes.verbatim_quote: Okay, we proceed with merge. Yeah, now no similar resources are found. So, it looks like we completed the task, right?
codes.context: Verifying task completion by confirming similar resources notification has disappeared after merges

codes.verbatim_quote: Use the integrated time machine system to restore the record to the version before you added Caroline Scagel as an author. But we have no deleted resources in the time vault. And there is no time machine
codes.context: Task 3: Initial confusion between 'time vault' feature (for deleted resources) and 'time machine' feature (for version history)

codes.verbatim_quote: It seems that on some step before we just opened a new window and that's why we couldn't merge this
codes.context: User realizes opening new browser window in previous task caused navigation confusion

codes.verbatim_quote: We have some history in the browser, but it's not pretty clear which item we need here. So, okay, which item we need here. So, we're just looking at it this way
codes.context: Attempting to navigate back to article page using browser history but uncertain about correct entry

codes.verbatim_quote: Okay, we are back to the article page and we have here the time machine. So, it's not time vault, it's time machine
codes.context: Successfully locating time machine feature on article entity page and clarifying terminology

codes.verbatim_quote: Okay, and we need to restore previous version before we added a new author. Okay, it looks like we have only one snapshot, so we are going to restore it
codes.context: Identifying correct snapshot in time machine timeline to restore version before Caroline Scagel addition

codes.verbatim_quote: So, and now we have exactly the same record that existed before our changes. Okay, it looks like we're done with this task also
codes.context: Confirming successful restoration to previous version and verifying changes were reverted

codes.verbatim_quote: And now we need to create new publication record. It looks like we need this one. And this is specific journal article, so we are choosing the here journal article
codes.context: Task 4: Navigating to add new record and correctly selecting 'journal article' as resource type

codes.verbatim_quote: We need the identifier, which is DOI, I think. Yes, it's the first one. It's not the only one, but it's the first one
codes.context: Recognizing DOI as primary identifier for journal article and entering it in form

codes.verbatim_quote: So, we have the identifier. We need to insert the title. Okay, we copy. It looks like we have some artifacts
codes.context: Copying title text from task instructions and noticing formatting artifacts in pasted content

codes.verbatim_quote: And we need to add an author. Arcangelo Massari with ORCID. And we will look for this one, but no author with this identifier. Why?
codes.context: Attempting to search for Arcangelo Massari using ORCID identifier but receiving no results

codes.verbatim_quote: And we need to add Silvio Peroni as another author with ORCID. Okay, and again no results. So, we need to add by hand again
codes.context: Experiencing same ORCID lookup failure for second author Silvio Peroni

codes.verbatim_quote: That's strange. There is no integration with ORCID
codes.context: Concluding that system lacks ORCID API integration after repeated lookup failures

codes.verbatim_quote: Okay, so we have publisher. We have the field. No identifier for publisher. Why publisher have name and given name? That's kind of strange. Why so? Publisher can be a person, I suppose, but usually it's not a person. It's kind of organization or something like this
codes.context: Finding publisher entity structure confusing with 'name' and 'given name' fields typically associated with persons rather than organizations

codes.verbatim_quote: We need to add issue. It's number 20. And we need to add volume. Volume number 9. Fine
codes.context: Methodically entering issue and volume numbers for journal article metadata

codes.verbatim_quote: What else we have about the journal? Aha, we have the journal title. Yes, and we have where we can add ISSN. No field for ISSN, right? Hmm. So, we have no place for ISSN
codes.context: Looking for field to enter journal ISSN identifier but unable to locate it in form structure

codes.verbatim_quote: So, add new record. And we confirm. Okay. So, we have it here
codes.context: Successfully submitting new journal article record and confirming it appears in system

codes.verbatim_quote: And it looks like all tasks are finished. It was pretty nice. Only a couple of points were not quite clear. But I think we've done pretty fast with the task
codes.context: Final reflection on usability test: overall positive experience with minor unclear elements, completed faster than expected

codes.verbatim_quote: The clean, consistent layout with clear field grouping, and the straightforward navigation and labeling that made it obvious what to do next
codes.context: Written reflection: user appreciated organized field grouping and logical sequence that minimized cognitive load during task completion

codes.verbatim_quote: logical sequence of fields that kept the cognitive load low
codes.context: Written reflection: highlighting importance of field ordering in maintaining low cognitive burden during data entry

codes.verbatim_quote: Bulk import of data
codes.context: Written suggestion: user desires bulk data import functionality as additional feature for efficiency

codes.verbatim_quote: Smart name parsing (e.g., split 'Name' into Given/Family with a confirmation)
codes.context: Written suggestion: user wants automatic parsing of full names into separate given/family name fields with confirmation dialog to reduce manual entry effort

codes.verbatim_quote: inline validation/microcopy (e.g., 'Given name = first name')
codes.context: Written suggestion: user wants inline help text explaining field meanings to prevent data entry errors

codes.verbatim_quote: placeholder text clarifying each field (e.g., 'Given name (first name)', 'Family name (surname)')
codes.context: Written note: user suggests placeholder text in form fields to clarify expected input format and prevent errors like entering full name in single field

codes.verbatim_quote: With the integrations above, it could also plug into more automated pipelines
codes.context: Written reflection: user sees potential for HERITRACE to integrate with automated workflows if certain features (ORCID lookup, bulk import, smart parsing) are implemented

codes.verbatim_quote: When adding authors for new article task I entered Silvio and Archangelo into the Name field and skipped Given name, which resulted in this record: Arcangelo & Silvio (2025)
codes.context: Written note: user documented specific error where entering both authors' names in single 'Name' field created malformed record, demonstrating need for field clarification
